intro: Calydorea nuda, commonly known as the naked calydorea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its delicate, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red in color. The plant has simple, opposite leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in moist forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
